title: Drawing, "An escutcheon, with a dedication", 1750–75
medium: pen and ink, brush and glack and gray watercolor, black chalk on paper.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description:
A stone tablet is in front of another, with stucco forms at edges. Above is a straight entablature, with stucco scrolls at left.  Above it lies a trophy of arms; others lie upon the lower scrolls. Written on tablet:
"AL EXMO SOR/ DN JOAQUIN DE FONSEUIELA/ TENTE GRAL EN LOS RES EXERCOS/ GOVERNADOR MILITAR/ Y POLITICO DE LA CUIDAD/ DE CADIZ."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "An escutcheon, with a dedication", 1750–75.
1750–75. pen and ink, brush and glack and gray watercolor, black chalk on paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2215.
